III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The agency was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
• Discussed with the administration that they need to keep licensing updated on
program changes. They will also need to provide a new program statement and
policies/procedures prior to opening any new program.
V. CONSULTATION
The agency was offered consultation in the following areas:
• Consultation was not required or requested.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
2

Maltreatment in Care
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has not been required to submit any corrective action plans during this
period under review.
Financial Overview
There are no financial concerns identified based on the review of the facility's
budget and the agency's financial audit.
PREA compliance (if applicable)
N/A
Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrator Assessment addresses the fact that currently (Reporting
period) there is no programing at this facility. This report also identifies that there is
an active search to develop a program to meet the needs in the community.
Staff and Youth Interviews
The three staff involved in this program; Program Director, Program Manager, and
Supervisor were interviewed. All report efforts to develop a new programing but
having no decision of what it will involve at this time. They are seeking input from
numerous services within the community in an effort to identify needs. They
reported working with the local juvenile home for a respite program for youth with
low violations.
There are no youth in the program at this time, so no interviews of youth took place.
Description of Agency Walk Through
This is a single-story building in good repair and clean. All plumbing was working as
required and the facility is appropriately furnished. Currently, the facility is being
painted on the inside and minor repairs are being accomplished. Items required
locking up (medication and cleaning supplies) were found to be locked
appropriately. Although there is no medication in need of being locked up at this
time, there is appropriate storage which can be locked as required.
3

VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules. It is recommended that the agency continue on their regular license.
